doc:
Felice Orlandi https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felice_Orlandi 0 Felice Orlandi (18 September 1925 – 21 May 2003) was an Italian-born American actor, known for roles in films such as The Pusher (1960), Bullitt (1968), Catch-22 (1970) and The Driver (1978). He also appeared in numerous TV series during the 1960s-1980s, including Gunsmoke, Mannix, Hogan's Heroes, Hawaii Five-O and Hill Street Blues. A native of Avezzano in Italy, he was raised in Cleveland, and earned a theater arts degree at Carnegie Tech (now Carnegie Mellon). He made his Broadway debut in 1954 in The Girl on the Via Flaminia. He was married to actress Alice Ghostley. He died of lung cancer in Burbank, California, at age 77. Felice_Orlandi ( 18_September_1925 – 21_May_2003 ) was an_Italian-born_American_actor , known for roles in films such_as The_Pusher ( 1960 ) , Bullitt ( 1968 ) , Catch-22 ( 1970 ) and The_Driver ( 1978 ) . He also appeared in numerous_TV_series during the_1960s-1980s , including Gunsmoke , Mannix , Hogan 's_Heroes , Hawaii_Five-O and Hill_Street_Blues . A_native of Avezzano in Italy , he was_raised in Cleveland , and earned a_theater_arts_degree at Carnegie_Tech ( now Carnegie_Mellon_) . He made his_Broadway_debut in 1954 in The_Girl on the_Via_Flaminia . He was_married to actress_Alice_Ghostley . He died of lung_cancer in Burbank , California , at age_77 .
